messages.subject: OH Laws
messages.msgSnippet: I just saw this post, and I thought I would respond. Someone else may have already, but I haven t gotten through the other posts yet, because we did just get
messages.messageBody:
I just saw this post, and I thought I would respond. Someone else may have
already, but I haven't gotten through the other posts yet, because we did
just get back from the Waterpark gathering!



Anyway, you do not have to do testing at the end of the year. You can just
have a certified teacher sign off saying your child is doing fine. There are
many of these unschooling friendly people that will help you with this.
Sometimes you can make an agreement with the superintendent in your area to
do your own assessment, just depends on the district.



Amie



"What would it be like if you lived each day, each breath, as a work of art
in progress? Imagine that you are a masterpiece unfolding, every second of
every day, a work of art taking form with every breath."

~Thomas Crum





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
